alert.note: Alert for Kingfisher; Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:40AM CDT until July 11 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN KINGFISHER, WESTERN LINCOLN, SOUTHERN LOGAN AND NORTHERN OKLAHOMA COUNTIES... At 440 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported areas of flash flooding from earlier heavy rain. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northeastern Oklahoma City, Edmond, Guthrie, Kingfisher, Chandler, Choctaw, Harrah, Jones, Luther, Cashion, Wellston, Carney, Cedar Valley, Arcadia, Cimarron City, Warwick, Meridian, Fallis, Seward and Navina. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
